intro: Polybotrya crespiana, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in cloud forests.
